Application_Facts: Mrs. Goodluck sought refugee status; her children were granted it while she was denied
Court_Ruling: Allowed application, remitted for redetermination by new panel
Defendant_Behavior: Board relied on limited evidence and made selective credibility findings
Grounds_for_Claim: Inadequate evaluation of state protection in Guyana
Legal_Standard: Proper consideration of all relevant evidence
Assessment_Factor: Effectiveness of domestic violence laws in Guyana
Credibility_Assessment: Found not credible due to inconsistencies
Evidence_Used: Reports on enforcement of domestic violence laws in Guyana
Application_Basis: Fear of persecution related to domestic violence and lack of state protection
Evidence_Assessed: Contradictory reports on state protection effectiveness ignored
Governing_Rule: Board must consider all relevant evidence and avoid unreasonable credibility findings
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to consider country condition reports showing ineffective enforcement
Outcome: Application allowed; decision overturned and remitted
Harm_Assessment: Risk of harm due to domestic violence and lack of state protection in Guyana
Cause_Description: Denial of refugee status despite children being granted protection; credibility and state protection misassessed
Evidence_Handling: Selective review of evidence; disregard of contrary documentation
Evidence_Issues: Incomplete consideration of country condition evidence
Decision_Rationale: Board failed to reasonably assess credibility and state protection based on full evidentiary record
Evidentiary_Issues: Reliance on presumed state protection despite evidence of ineffectiveness
